tldr: Q1 2025 beat outlook with over $1.3B in sales (+12%), record gross margin, and non-GAAP EPS of $4.20. Demand stayed solid into Q2, but higher tariff costs pushed down full-year margin and EPS guidance.
bullets: Sales grew 12% to over $1.3B with adjusted EBITDA margin of 22.3% and non-GAAP EPS of $4.20 (+42% YoY).
Asset Intelligence and Tracking grew 18% and EVM grew 9%; all regions posted growth led by EMEA and Latin America.
Tariff outlook worsened: full-year gross profit impact now about $70M after mitigation; Q2 guide calls for ~4% to 7% sales growth.
themes: RFID and asset tracking attach expanding
Machine-vision capability expanding automation use cases

segments.title: Asset Intelligence and Tracking
points: Segment sales grew 18% on strong printing and RFID demand.
RFID adoption continued across retail, logistics, and government workflows.

segments.title: Enterprise Visibility and Mobility
points: Segment sales grew 9% with broad product category strength.
Service and software recurring revenue grew slightly amid prior-year install base dynamics.

segments.title: Regional performance
points: North America +7%, EMEA +18%, Asia Pacific +13%, Latin America +18%.
Manufacturing lagged other verticals but still grew high single digits.

notes.title: Tariffs
points: Annualized gross profit impact now expected at $80M to $90M after mitigation.
Full-year impact estimated at about $70M with $25M to $30M expected in Q2.

notes.title: Capital allocation
points: Repurchased $125M in Q1 and $75M in April.
Acquired Photoneo for $62M, adding 3D machine vision capabilities.

themes.title: Demand stability
points: Management said retail strength carried into Q1 and demand remained solid into April.
Customers remain positive but cautious amid trade policy uncertainty.

themes.title: Tariff mitigation
points: Supply chain shifts can take 12 to 18 months depending on site readiness.
Pricing actions and production moves are key levers to offset tariff impact.

top_questions.question: Is demand changing as tariffs evolve?
top_questions.summary: Zebra reported stable demand and projects moving forward, but customers are cautious.

top_questions.question: How quickly can supply chain shifts mitigate tariffs?
top_questions.summary: Moves typically take 12 to 18 months; CapEx is limited due to partner-led production.

top_questions.question: Why was EMEA growth higher than North America?
top_questions.summary: Management cited easier prior-year comparisons in EMEA and large retail projects.

implications: Tariff uncertainty is pressuring margin outlook despite strong demand and operating leverage.
Photoneo acquisition expands machine vision exposure beyond core mobility and printing.
competitive_notes: Pricing actions are a key lever but realization varies by product and contract mix.
forecast_hooks: Track Q2 tariff impact and pricing realization as the April price actions ramp.
Watch manufacturing recovery and machine vision momentum through 2025.

action_items: Monitor customer behavior for signs of tariff-driven order pull-forward.
Track timing and magnitude of additional pricing actions.
open_questions: How quickly can additional tariff mitigation move the full-year impact below $70M?
Will service and software growth re-accelerate as the installed base rebuilds?
watch_next_quarter: Q2 sales growth and margin impact from tariffs.
Early contributions from the Photoneo acquisition.
